definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time

sentences.english: Hereby I would sincerely recommend this highly-talented student to your institution.
sentences.chinese: 在此我郑重的向贵校推荐这位才华出众的学生。

sentences.english: Appreciation of your high talents and literary attainments.
sentences.chinese: 对你的出众才华和文学造诣的赏识。

sentences.english: We do have a remarkable talent for cooking up crazy get-rich schemes.
sentences.chinese: 在炮制疯狂发财计划方面，我们的确有过人才华。

sentences.english: Only by sticking to the socialist road can we do away with the root cause of poverty. (p. 330)
sentences.chinese: 只有坚定走社会主义门路才华挖失落穷根。

sentences.english: Such is the talent of the director.
sentences.chinese: 这就是导演才华洋溢的地方。

sentences.english: He is a marvelously able author.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位才华出众的作家。

sentences.english: She is intelligent in business with creative mind.
sentences.chinese: 甚具商业头脑，饶富创意有才华。

sentences.english: It is just my wisdom and talent crystalized.
sentences.chinese: 那只是我才华和智慧的结晶。

sentences.english: I must admit that he is a pretty talented person.
sentences.chinese: 不过说句公道话，我得承认他是个很有才华的人。
她是位有才华的歌唱家。

sentences.english: This brilliant engineer and droid technician operated out of the Minos Cluster.
sentences.chinese: 这位才华横溢的机器人工程技师在米诺斯星团外工作。

sentences.english: In 1998 he was discovered in a talent contest where he displayed his piano and song-writing skills.
sentences.chinese: 1998年，由于他的钢琴和歌曲创作才华而被发现。
她是个才华洋溢的设计师。

sentences.english: Electronic computers must be programmed before they can work.
sentences.chinese: 必须为电子谋划机编好程序，它才华工作。

sentences.english: His brilliance raised him above the ruck .
sentences.chinese: 他的才华使他从普通人群中脱颖而出。

definition: literary talent/literary grace/rich and bright colors
